description:
Kaito Kuroba, a normal teenage student whose father is often absent. When his father dies under mysterious circumstances, he is made aware of his father's secret identity; a famous international criminal known as International Criminal 1412: the Phantom Thief, and that he was murdered by a mysterious organization for refusing to aid them in retrieving the "Pandora Gem"; a mystical stone said to shed a "tear" during the passing of a particular comet (often called the 'Volley Comet'), the consumption of which bestows immortality.

He vows to prevent the organization from gaining immortality, and assumes his father's identity as he begins his quest for the gem. His only clues as to the gem's location are that it glows red under the full moon and that it is a doublet: a gem hidden within a larger gem. Thus, it would have to be a relatively large one with a bizarre history, and always stored in a place that never receives moonlight. He thus researches and steals famous priceless gems with odd histories from incredibly well-defended areas, and always returns them after the very next full moon.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

__Website | Twitter__ Birth: CHiCO's year of birth and any further information of her early life is currently unknown or not publicly revealed. Her birth was privately held, and only shown to be on a January 27. Biography: CHiCO is a female japanese singer that is currently under the label: MusicRay'n Inc. While growing up CHiCO was very interested in anison (a term used to abbreviate Anime song, but is also used generally when referring to anime music that has a focus on opening and ending theme songs). Upon entering high school she was introduced to a voice training teacher by an acquaintance she knew at the time, this pushed her to become a professional singer. In the summer of 2013, CHiCO entered the national singer audition "Utakatsu!" (specializing in "Anison" and "Vocaloid") hosted by Sony Music Entertainment SD Group. She won the grand prize at the contest, which led to a decision to collaborate with the creator group "[HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863/HoneyWorks)". On the 6th of August, 2014, CHiCO debuted with the opening theme song for the anime "Ao Haru Ride" named "Sekai wa Koi Ni Ochiteiru" under the guise of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks". This was her official debut as a singer. On the 18th of November, 2015, CHiCO together with HoneyWorks released their first album named "Sekai Ha i Ni Michiteiru". This was CHiCO's first ever album release, and the album sold 24,000 copies during its first week of sale.

[Website](https://www.galileogalilei.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/galileo_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/galileogalileiphoto/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/galileogalileiofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/galileogalileiSMEJ)

Galileo Galilei is a Japanese four-piece rock band who were initially active between 2007 to 2016, however they made a return in 2022 and have since resumed band activities. They are signed to independent record label Ouchi Daisuki Club Records (2022–), but were signed to SME Records (2007–2016). 

At their first Nippon Budokan performance held on October 11, 2016 it was announced that they would retire. After the band retired, Yuuki Ozaki, Kazuki Ozaki and Hitoshi Sakou continued in a new band named [BBHF](https://anilist.co/staff/174061).

The band announced a return on October 11, 2022 at the warbear's "re:bear" live concert after an exact 6 years hiatus. Upon returning their lineup consisted of two of the original members Yuuki Ozaki and Kazuki Ozaki, accompanied by Fumito Iwai and Masaki Okazaki. Their first album release after returning was Bee And The Whales on May 31st, 2023.

On August 30, 2023 they had a special collaboration with [Porter Robinson](https://anilist.co/staff/120603/Porter-Robinson) with a new take on the song "[Circle Game -ANOHANA Ver.-](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H6CE9uJwH8U)". The original version of the song first appeared in the movie adaption of the anime _[Anohana the Movie: The Flower We Saw That Day](https://anilist.co/anime/15039/Ano-Hi-Mita-Hana-no-Namae-wo-Bokutachi-wa-Mada-Shiranai-Movie/)_.

__Members:__
- [Yuuki Ozaki](https://anilist.co/staff/149245/Yuuki-Ozaki) (尾崎雄貴) – vocalist, guitarist, synthesizer, programmer, in-charge of lyrics and composition (2007–2016, 2022–)
- Kazuki Ozaki (尾崎和樹) – drummer, guitarist, percussionist, rhythm machine, synthesizer, programmer (2007–2016, 2022–)
- Fumito Iwai (岩井郁人) – guitarist, bassist, chorus, synthesizer, programmer (2009–2012, 2022–)
- Masaki Okazaki (岡崎真輝) – bassist (2022–)

__Former Members:__
- Hitoshi Sakou (佐孝仁司) – bassist, guitarist, synthesizer, programmer (2007–2016)
- Souhei Funaya (船谷創平) – guitarist (2007–2009)
- Kazumasa Noguchi (野口一雅) – pianist, organist, bassist, percussionist, synthesizer (2011–2012)
**Tomonori Ochikoshi** is a Japanese producer. He is affiliated with studio A-1 Pictures.
__Kudou Susumu__ is a director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Minezawa)

Currently freelance. Formerly affiliated with Studio Gross.

During their time at Studio Gross they worked as an in-between animator, key animator, animation director and episode director.

Freelancer originating from [E&G Films](https://anilist.co/studio/154/).

Frequently works with [Kenji Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102217/), whom he met during his days at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) in the early '00s.
__Kudou Susumu__ is a director and storyboard artist.

Worked as a finishing artist at [The Answer Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/229/) before joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) as an animator. She has since shifted her focus from animating to storyboarding and directing episodes herself.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118328356)

Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures), he is now affiliated with [CygamesPictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Minezawa)

Currently freelance. Formerly affiliated with Studio Gross.

During their time at Studio Gross they worked as an in-between animator, key animator, animation director and episode director.

**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)
